intro: Achyrophorus tenuisectus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Capparaceae, which includes plants characterized by their small, often succulent leaves and flowers. The plant has a compact, mat-forming growth habit, with stems that often lie close to the ground. Its leaves are typically linear to lanceolate, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils with low moisture availability.
